title: Asia-Pacific tourism industry gears up to welcome Mid-Autumn Festival this September 27 - Travelandtourworld.comTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Asia-Pacific tourism industry gears up to welcome Mid-Autumn Festival this September 27  
On the 15th of the lunar calendar, each month, the moon is at its roundest and brightest, symbolizing togetherness and reunion in Chinese culture. Families get together to express their familial love by eating dinner together, appreciating the moon, eating mooncakes, etc. The harvest moon is traditionally believed to be the brightest of the year.The Mid-Autumn Festival is the second most important festival to Chinese people after the Spring Festival. Every year, when the festival comes, Chinese go home from every corner of the country and the world for family reunions.
The Lantern Carnivals,a part of the revelry, besides showcasing an incredible variety of colorful, bright shiny lanterns, feature also many cultural events and performances including song and dances, kung fu, acrobatics, craft demonstrations and the like.
Mooncakes are traditional Chinese pastries eaten to celebrate the Mid-Autumn Festival. The festival typically involves much giving, receiving, and eating of mooncakes.
The best places to witness the festival in China are as follows:-
Beihai Park in Beijing The Oriental Pearl TV Tower in Shanghai Elephant Trunk Hill in Guilin Victoria Park in Hong Kong West Lake in Hangzhou Night Cruising on the Pearl River in Guangzhou Erhai Lake in Dali Tour China During the Mid-Autumn Festival In Taipei, the most picturesque spots to view the full moon in the evening of Sept. 27 include Yangmingshan, Daan Park, Danshui Fisherman’s Wharf and Maokong.
Featuring more than 40 varieties of chrysanthemums,Gardens by the Bay’s Celebration is one of the highlights of the Mid-Autumn Festival in Singapore.
 
Vietnamese private carrier VietJet Air (VJA) is launching a program to celebrate this year’s Mid-Autumn Festival.The program, titled “A Flight Back to Childhood,” will immerse passengers in a wonderfully festive atmosphere.
